generics.sorry cant anwser1: We have detected content in your text that may not align with our internal policies. We kindly ask you to review and adjust the text you have provided. If the problem persists, please consider visiting us again another day as we work to improve the experience. You can also provide an alternative description. For immediate assistance, please contact our dedicated support team at support@foundation29.org. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused. Remember the importance of complying with our usage guidelines to maintain access to our tool.
generics.sorry cant anwser2: We can't answer that right now. Please try again another day to give us time to fix it. In the meantime, you can select another option. If you need immediate help, please write to our support team: support@foundation29.org. We apologize for the inconvenience.
generics.sorry cant anwser3: The maximum length is 8000 characters. Please reduce the length of the description.
generics.excessCharacters: The maximum length is 8000 characters. You have exceeded it by {{excessCharacters}} characters. Please reduce the length of the description.
generics.Translation error: There was an error with the translation service, please modify the patient description and try again.

generics.errorDiseaseName: The disease name format is invalid. Please review the disease name and try again.
generics.minDescriptionLength: The description must be at least 100 characters long to perform an accurate analysis.
generics.unsupported language: Sorry, the language you have written the patient description in is not supported. Please write the patient description in another language.

generics.recommendedLength: Recommended: max. 2000–3000 characters for best results.
generics.aiSummaryWarning: Note: AI-generated summaries may contain errors and should be reviewed carefully.
generics.textTooLongMaxModel: The text exceeds the maximum limit of 400,000 characters allowed by the model. Please shorten the text significantly to continue.

policy.p2.1: 1. Who we are and how to contact us
policy.p2.2: Foundation 29 of February ("DxGPT", "we", "us") is the data controller for personal data processed through the DxGPT platform. As a non-profit organization, we prioritize privacy and promote responsible handling of patient data.
policy.p2.5: Regulatory status, not a medical device
policy.p2.6: DxGPT is not a medical device under the EU MDR, US FDA, or other applicable regulations. It is provided solely as a clinical decision support tool for qualified healthcare professionals. It should not replace professional medical judgment, diagnosis, or treatment.
policy.p3.3: Age, gender, symptoms, and other details you enter when requesting diagnostic suggestions.
policy.p3.4: Feedback, survey responses, or support inquiries (email, message content).
policy.p3.6: Health information you submit is considered special category personal data under Article 9 of the GDPR and as protected health information (PHI) under US HIPAA law.
policy.p3.8: IP address, cookies, browser type, operating system, device identifiers.
policy.p3.9: Usage statistics processed by trusted analytics partners to improve usability.
policy.p4.4: Provide diagnostic suggestions and core features
policy.p4.6: Process health data you voluntarily provide
policy.p4.8: Improve, protect, and debug the service
policy.p4.10: Comply with legal obligations (e.g., fraud prevention, regulatory requirements)
policy.p5.2: Provide personalized diagnostic suggestions and related functionalities.
policy.p5.3: Respond to feedback and support inquiries.
policy.p5.4: Analyze aggregate usage to improve algorithms and user experience.
policy.p5.5: Enforce our terms of service and protect the platform's security.
policy.p5.6: DxGPT will never sell, rent, or share your personal data, or any other type of data, with third parties for marketing or any other purpose. This commitment is permanent and irreversible, and since we remove individual identifiers at the source and store only masked data, such sharing is technically unfeasible.
policy.p5.7: However, we may disclose fully anonymized and aggregated usage statistics that cannot be linked to any individual user.
policy.p6.2: All data channels are protected by encryption in transit and at rest.
policy.p6.3: An artificial intelligence-based system automatically detects personal identifiers and replaces them with asterisks (***) before storage.
policy.p6.4: Unmasked health information is never written to disk; processing occurs only in volatile memory.
policy.p6.5: Technical and organizational measures compliant with ISO 27001 and NIST SP 800-88 standards are applied.
policy.p6.6: Access is restricted solely to authorized personnel under strict confidentiality.
policy.p6.7: HIPAA Compliance, DxGPT is HIPAA compliant (Privacy, Security, and Breach Notification Rules) and signs Business Associate Agreements (BAAs). See Appendix A for details.
policy.p7.2: Anonymized and aggregated usage data is retained for a maximum of 5 years before being irreversibly deleted.
policy.p7.3: Support inquiries and contractual records are stored for up to 5 years to comply with accounting and legal requirements.
policy.p7.4: You may request their early deletion where permitted by the GDPR (see section 8).
policy.p8.2: Whenever possible, your data is processed in the nearest geographical region to minimize latency and respect local jurisdiction.
policy.p8.3: For users located in the European Economic Area (EEA), all personal data is stored and processed exclusively on servers physically located within the European Union.
policy.p8.4: When processing occurs outside the EEA, we rely on Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) or adequacy decisions to ensure an adequate level of protection (Art. 46 of the GDPR). In light of the CJEU's Schrems II ruling, we also implement supplementary technical and organizational measures such as end-to-end encryption, strict access controls, and detailed audit logs to minimize the risk of unauthorized government access.
policy.p9.3: Access the personal data we hold about you (Art. 15).
policy.p9.5: Erase your data ('right to be forgotten', Art. 17).
policy.p9.7: Object to processing based on legitimate interests (Art. 21).
policy.p9.8: Data portability, to receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format (Art. 20).
policy.p9.9: Withdraw your consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of prior processing.
policy.p9.10: Lodge a complaint with your local supervisory authority.
policy.p10.2: To exercise any of the above rights or raise a privacy concern, please contact our DPO at privacy@foundation29.org or write to us at the address provided in section 1.
policy.p10.3: We are committed to responding to all legitimate requests within one calendar month. Complex requests may require up to two additional months, in which case we will notify you.
policy.p11.2: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Significant changes will be announced within the DxGPT interface or by email. The 'Last updated' date at the top of this page indicates when revisions were made.
policy.p12.2: Privacy Rule, Protected Health Information (PHI) is only used or disclosed when permitted or with explicit patient authorization, and in accordance with the minimum necessary principle.
policy.p12.3: Security Rule, Administrative, physical, and technical safeguards such as encryption at rest, role-based access controls, audit logs, and regular risk assessments protect electronic PHI.
policy.p12.4: Breach Notification Rule, If a breach involving PHI occurs, we notify affected individuals and the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services without undue delay and in no case later than 60 days after its discovery.
policy.p12.5: Business Associate Agreements (BAAs), We sign BAAs with each vendor that handles PHI on our behalf, contractually requiring them to apply protection measures equivalent to those of HIPAA.
policy.Foundation 29: © 2025 Foundation 29 of February. All rights reserved.

policyShort.p1.1: DxGPT is managed by the Foundation 29 of February.
policyShort.p1.2: Write to our Data Protection Officer (DPO) at privacy@foundation29.org.
policyShort.p1.4: Not a medical device, DxGPT only helps doctors think about possible diagnoses. It does not replace a healthcare professional.
policyShort.p2.1: You give us: age, gender, symptoms, comments, and your email if you write to us.
policyShort.p2.2: Sensitive information: health details you provide.
policyShort.p2.3: We automatically collect: your IP, cookies, device type, and how you use the app.
policyShort.p3.1: To run the app and give you suggestions.
policyShort.p3.2: To improve and secure the app.
policyShort.p3.3: Because some laws require us to keep certain data.
policyShort.p4: 4. What we do with your data
policyShort.p4.1: Give you suggestions and answer your questions.
policyShort.p4.2: Protect the app from errors and attacks.
policyShort.p4.3: We never sell or rent your data. We may share general figures (without names) to show how the app is used.
policyShort.p5.1: We use strong encryption to protect the data.
policyShort.p5.2: An AI hides your name and other personal data with *** before saving anything.
policyShort.p5.3: Only authorized personnel can see the data.
policyShort.p6.2: Support emails and payment notes: up to 5 years (by law).
policyShort.p7.1: If you live in Europe, your data is stored on servers within the EU.
policyShort.p7.2: If data is moved outside, we use special contracts and encryption to keep it protected.
policyShort.p8.7: Change your mind and withdraw your consent.
policyShort.p9.1: Write to privacy@foundation29.org. We respond within 1 month (or let you know if we need more time).
policyShort.p10.1: If we change this policy, we will tell you in the app or by email.

land.disclaimer:
DxGPT is a research experiment that uses a general-purpose artificial intelligence. Specifically, it uses OpenAI's GPT-4 language model as a predictive model for a tool that provides information about rare diseases. It is designed to provide general information and suggestions based on the symptoms provided. The tool is not intended to replace professional medical advice or endorse diagnosis, prevention, monitoring, prediction, or treatment and should never be used to make diagnostic judgments with real patients.

Because AI can produce variable results, the accuracy of the tool's diagnosis and suggestions may vary, so it is important to consult a qualified healthcare professional to ensure an accurate and appropriate diagnosis. The use of this tool is at the user's own risk and Foundation 29 is not responsible for any consequences or damages that may arise from its use.

By using this tool, the user acknowledges that they have read and understood this disclaimer, and any potential risks associated with the use of the artificial intelligence-based tool.
land.check: Do not show this message again
land.Recommendations: For best results, indicate when and why you think the symptoms appeared
land.required: Please provide patient details (age, gender, symptoms) and when they started. Example: Female, 42 years old, severe headaches for 3 months, dizziness, family history of migraines.
land.searchFile: You can also upload a full report. This functionality is in testing and may produce unexpected results. DxGPT will suggest the diagnosis that the model considers most appropriate for that patient. To comply with data protection laws, we do not store personal patient data, and the data is deleted at the end of this session. We would be interested in your feedback for future developments.
land.error extension: The uploaded file must have a .pdf, .docx or image file extension

land.swal2: We are experiencing high demand, if it takes longer than 2 minutes, please cancel and try again.
land.swal3: Help us improve, indicate the quality of the result by clicking on the thumbs.

land.swal2Multimodal: We are extracting and analyzing the content of your documents and images.
land.swal3Multimodal: Once completed, review the generated text and click search to continue.

land.title: Enter a brief description of the patient and DxGPT will provide you with a list of possible disease diagnoses
land.p1.title: Examples
land.p1.subtitle: Click on the text to use it as an example
land.p1.1: The patient is thirteen months old. First focal seizure at three months. Multiple tonic-clonic seizures. Febrile seizures. One status epilepticus at eight months.
land.p1.2: Girl. 11 years old. Unilateral hemispheric atrophy, associated with drug-resistant focal epilepsy, progressive hemiplegia, and cognitive impairment
land.p2.title: Capabilities
land.p2.subtitle: Main features of DxGPT
land.p2.1: Shows detailed descriptions with matching and non-matching symptoms
land.p2.2: Offers a differential diagnosis when clicking on each disease
land.p2.3: Allows improving the patient's description through AI questions
land.p2.4: Has an advanced mode for more accurate analysis
land.p3.title: Limitations
land.p3.subtitle: Aspects to consider when using DxGPT
land.p3.1: Occasionally it may generate incorrect information
land.p3.2: Cannot be used for diagnosis without human supervision

timeline.subtitle3: the process of diagnosing rare diseases and their treatment in an easy and simple way.
timeline.footer1: We are a non-profit organization that designs and creates tools for patients to manage their own data,
timeline.footer2: revolutionizing the diagnosis and management of rare diseases. We empower patients and doctors to use

cookie.message: This application uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our application.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.p1.1: Foundation 29, as the data controller for the data provided through its website, recognizes the importance of current regulations regarding privacy and data protection. In this sense, protecting the security, integrity, and confidentiality of our clients' and users' information is very important to us, and therefore, we want to act responsibly in this matter. This page describes the cookie policy we use on our website https://dxgpt.app (hereinafter the website).
cookies.p1.2: For the purposes of this Cookie Policy, the provisions contained in the Legal Notice and the Privacy Policy will apply jointly.
cookies.p2.1: As indicated in the first layer ("cookie banner"), the user has accepted or can accept this cookie policy. The fact that a user employs technical means to prevent the download of cookies in their browser does not invalidate the consent given for legal purposes, although the technical result may involve the partial or total non-download of them with the effects described later in this cookie policy.
cookies.p3.1: At Foundation 29, we use cookies to make user navigation on our website more functional and useful. In this sense, and with the aim of guaranteeing the user all the necessary information for their correct navigation, we provide the following informative text about what cookies are and how the user can disable them.
cookies.p4.1: Currently, all websites (regardless of the service they provide) use cookies, that is, they save a minimum amount of information about the use made by the user on the web pages they visit. Therefore, a cookie can be defined as a small text file or a widely used device that is downloaded to the user's terminal equipment when browsing web pages in order to store data that can be updated and retrieved by the entity responsible for its installation.
cookies.t5: 5. Purposes, management of cookies, and types of cookies
cookies.p5.1: Technical cookies: are those that allow the user to navigate through a website, platform, or application and use the different options or services that exist in it, such as, for example, controlling traffic and data communication, identifying the session, accessing restricted access parts, using security elements during navigation, storing content for the dissemination of videos or sound, or sharing content through social networks.
cookies.p5.2: Analysis cookies: are those that allow the person responsible for them to monitor and analyze the behavior of the users of the websites to which they are linked. The information collected through this type of cookie is used in the measurement of the activity of the websites, application, or platform and for the creation of navigation profiles of the users of said sites, applications, and platforms, in order to introduce improvements based on the analysis of the usage data made by the users of the service.
cookies.p5.2.1: Google Analytics: is used to distinguish users
cookies.p5.2.2: Hotjar: is used to record the user's navigation through the website elements.
cookies.p5.3: The website does not use personalization cookies, advertising cookies, or behavioral advertising cookies.
cookies.p6.1: The user who wishes to disable cookies can do so from the preferences section of their Internet browser. Below, we indicate the links enabled by the most popular browsers, with instructions to manage cookies, on various devices and versions if necessary.

testimonials.title: Testimonials from our users
testimonials.testi1: I am convinced that this application can simplify the complexity of the healthcare process, without affecting its quality, which is the great challenge of any technological solution when it approaches the world of health. Furthermore, as the application is completely free, any healthcare professional or patient can use it without considering the economic implications and without compromising the privacy and security of its users.
testimonials.testi2: A good assistant that complements our differential diagnosis capacity, especially in those patients with less prevalent diseases, where it is not always possible to keep in mind all the diagnostic possibilities that make up a certain conjunction of symptoms, signs, and complementary tests.
testimonials.testi3: This tool is truly exceptional. It provides precise and accurate information, which is immensely valuable. What sets it apart is its ability to suggest additional symptoms crucial for diagnosis. It does not provide misleading or biased information. I am deeply impressed by its accuracy and usefulness. Highly recommended for anyone seeking reliable diagnostic support.
testimonials.testi4: This is wonderful! It would have taken me HOURS to give all my information to a doctor to even begin a diagnosis. I have suspected multiple sclerosis for a while, and it was the primary possibility. Really, thank you for this!
testimonials.testi5: I loved it, I'm not a doctor, so I'm aware of the limitations, but I still found it incredibly intuitive and it was quite useful for a non-medical professional to get information… Excellent APP.
testimonials.Julio Mayol: Julio Mayol, surgery specialist at Hospital Clínico San Carlos (Spain)
testimonials.Juanjo Ríos: Juanjo Ríos, medical director of Hospital La Paz (Spain)

undiagnosed.only_patient_description: The input text should only be a description of the patient (age, gender, symptoms, and when they started). Do not include questions, information about diseases, or treatments. This tool is for diagnostic aid only.

medicalInfoModal.disclaimerText: This tool is primarily designed to aid in diagnosis. Answers to general medical inquiries are for educational purposes only and should be critically evaluated. They do not replace professional medical advice.
medicalInfoModal.aiGeneratedWarning: Note: This text has been generated by artificial intelligence and may contain errors.

aboutUs.HERO_TITLE: DxGPT: Augmented Intelligence for Diagnostic Confidence
aboutUs.HERO_SUBTITLE: Transform clinical uncertainty into clarity. DxGPT is your diagnostic co-pilot: structure reasoning, reduce cognitive load, and minimize biases in seconds, even in complex or rare cases.
aboutUs.INTRO_TEXT: DxGPT is an augmented intelligence tool designed by and for the clinical environment. Unlike general-purpose AIs, it does not generate open narrative text, but a structured analysis of five diagnostic hypotheses, classified and reasoned with symptoms for and against. We use advanced language models, such as OpenAI's GPT-5, within a medical control framework that ensures relevance, consistency, and safety in every result. We do not replace clinical judgment: we enhance it. We offer you an instant differential analysis that saves time, neutralizes cognitive biases, and raises the quality of clinical reasoning from the very first moment.
aboutUs.CHALLENGE_TEXT: Diagnosis, especially in rare diseases, is a labyrinth of data and symptoms that consumes time and generates uncertainty. With over 10,000 rare diseases, most unknown to the average professional due to their low prevalence, familiarity is an impossible luxury. DxGPT acts as a powerful cognitive offloading tool, speeding up analysis and broadening the spectrum of possibilities to arrive at an accurate diagnosis sooner. In this context, support technology is no longer an option, but a necessity for patient safety and quality of care.
aboutUs.WHY_TITLE: Why DxGPT and not a general-purpose AI?
aboutUs.WHY_TEXT: Conversational tools like ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini are broad-spectrum language models. In the medical context, this flexibility is a fundamental weakness. Their unstructured nature can generate variable, incomplete, or clinically irrelevant responses, lacking the essential safety controls for high-risk decision-making.
aboutUs.DIFF_1_TEXT: While a generalist AI produces free text, DxGPT offers a rigorous and reproducible analysis of five diagnostic hypotheses. Each hypothesis includes compatible and incompatible symptoms, a format designed to challenge biases such as confirmation and availability bias. Our control over the instruction the model receives (the prompt) ensures consistent, reliable, and explainable results.
aboutUs.DIFF_2_TEXT: DxGPT operates within a control environment designed to mitigate the risks inherent in large language models (LLMs). Its architecture and results are supervised by healthcare professionals to ensure that the responses are not only technically correct, but also clinically relevant and safe.
aboutUs.DIFF_3_TEXT: DxGPT is designed to systematically include rare diseases in the differential diagnosis, an area where generalist systems, and often human reasoning, can fail. The system integrates specialized knowledge to detect atypical patterns and explore hypotheses that would otherwise be ignored, expanding the clinician's diagnostic radar and improving the chances of an early and accurate diagnosis.
aboutUs.IMPL_TEXT: When DxGPT is deployed in healthcare providers such as hospitals, it includes expanded capabilities:
aboutUs.IMPL_ITEM_1: Clinical data management (integration with hospital information systems).
aboutUs.IMPL_ITEM_2: Structured data collection (standardized formats for subsequent analysis).
aboutUs.IMPL_ITEM_3: Clinical feedback (professionals provide corrections and observations).
aboutUs.IMPL_ITEM_4: Exploration and improvement (continuous adjustment in real clinical practice).
aboutUs.IMPL_ITEM_5: Reinforced security (data protection and usage control aligned with healthcare regulations).
aboutUs.BENEFITS_1_TITLE: Reclaim time for what matters most: the patient
aboutUs.BENEFITS_1_TEXT: DxGPT automates the generation of the differential diagnosis, transforming minutes of search and uncertainty into seconds of structured analysis. This efficiency frees up the healthcare professional to focus on clinical judgment, patient communication, and decision-making.
aboutUs.BENEFITS_2_TITLE: From data chaos to diagnostic clarity
aboutUs.BENEFITS_2_TEXT: We present information in a clean, structured format, designed for clinical thinking. Hypotheses are displayed with symptoms for and against, allowing for quick evaluation and safer, more informed decision-making.
aboutUs.BENEFITS_3_TEXT: Unlike conversational AIs, DxGPT's interface is optimized for a single function: supporting diagnosis. Every element is designed to guide clinical reasoning efficiently and safely, eliminating distractions and focusing on practical utility.
aboutUs.BENEFITS_4_TITLE: A safety system against mental shortcuts
aboutUs.BENEFITS_4_TEXT: Clinical diagnosis is vulnerable to cognitive biases such as availability or confirmation bias. DxGPT acts as an objective counterweight, systematically presenting a range of possibilities based on the case evidence, including rare diseases. This promotes a more thorough evaluation and reduces the risk of diagnostic errors, improving patient safety.
aboutUs.BENEFITS_5_TEXT: DxGPT ensures that each case is analyzed with the same methodological rigor, regardless of the professional or the moment. This consistency reduces variability in the quality of care and establishes a high standard of analysis for the entire team. Our performance is continuously validated against a demanding bank of clinical cases to ensure constant reliability.
aboutUs.BENEFITS_6_TITLE: Created in clinical practice, for clinical practice
aboutUs.BENEFITS_6_TEXT: DxGPT is not a laboratory product. It has been developed in a continuous cycle of collaboration with frontline doctors, hospitals, and scientific societies. Its design and functionalities respond to the real challenges of diagnosis, ensuring that it is not only technologically advanced, but also clinically useful, relevant, and easy to integrate into the professional's mental workflow.
aboutUs.COMMIT_EXPERIMENTAL: DxGPT is an experimental platform in continuous improvement.
aboutUs.COMMIT_EXPERIMENTAL_TEXT: Its goal is to explore the capabilities of AI in diagnosis, understand its limitations, and improve it with user feedback and rigorous clinical validation. New findings are shared openly through GitHub and MedRxiv.
aboutUs.COMMIT_PRIVACY: DxGPT protects clinical data with European standards.
aboutUs.COMMIT_PRIVACY_TEXT: DxGPT ensures the protection of clinical data through strict anonymization, without storing personal information or using it for other purposes. All processing is carried out in European data centers under GDPR, ensuring security, privacy, and transparency in every interaction.
aboutUs.EVAL_SUBTITLE_1: Our commitment to evidence: The clinical validation framework
aboutUs.EVAL_TEXT_1: Confidence in a clinical tool is not given, it is earned with rigorous evidence. At DxGPT, validation is not an event, but a continuous process. Our performance was initially evaluated in an independent clinical validation conducted by the Sant Joan de Déu Hospital, whose results, published in medRxiv, demonstrated diagnostic accuracy comparable to that of clinical experts.
aboutUs.EVAL_TEXT_2: On that basis, we have built a Constant Validation Framework, an evaluation ecosystem designed to subject DxGPT to the challenges of real medical practice and ensure that its reliability constantly evolves.
aboutUs.EVAL_SUBTITLE_2: A testbed designed to challenge the system
aboutUs.EVAL_TEXT_3: We do not validate DxGPT with textbook cases. Our testbed contains over 1,000 real clinical cases, selected for their complexity: extensive descriptions, overlapping symptoms, and non-trivial differential diagnoses. These cases come from elite sources to ensure diversity and realism:
aboutUs.EVAL_SOURCE_1: High-level clinical question banks: MedBullets and MedQA USMLE.
aboutUs.EVAL_SOURCE_2: Scientific publications on rare diseases: RAMEDIS and Ramebench.
aboutUs.EVAL_SOURCE_3: Real cases from hospital emergency rooms: HM Hospitals and Hospital de Torrejón.
aboutUs.EVAL_SOURCE_4: Specialized collaborations: Supervised cases of rare diseases.
aboutUs.EVAL_TEXT_4: This demanding testbed ensures that we evaluate DxGPT in the most challenging environment possible, reflecting the complexity that healthcare professionals face every day.
aboutUs.EVAL_SUBTITLE_3: The science of asking: The secret to consistency
aboutUs.EVAL_TEXT_5: Our research has revealed a critical factor: the quality of an LLM's response depends decisively on the quality of the question. Therefore, we have developed and validated over 30 prompt formulations (instructions) to find the optimal structure that activates effective and consistent clinical reasoning.
aboutUs.EVAL_TEXT_6: This expert control over formulation is what differentiates DxGPT from a generalist AI. We do not leave the quality of the result to chance; we have designed a process that ensures that, for the same case, the system always applies the same analytical rigor, producing reliable and reproducible results.
aboutUs.EVAL_CHART_DESCRIPTION: The chart illustrates how our optimization of the formulation (the jump from the 4o → o3 family) not only increases accuracy (X-axis), but also allows solving cases of greater complexity (Y-axis), demonstrating a significant advance in the system's clinical reasoning ability.
aboutUs.EVAL_SUBTITLE_4: An evaluation methodology that thinks like a clinician
aboutUs.EVAL_TEXT_7: Measuring accuracy goes beyond a simple 'correct' or 'incorrect'. Our 3-level cascade evaluation process measures what really matters in clinical practice:
aboutUs.EVAL_METHOD_1: Objective Verification: We compare the main hypothesis with standardized medical codes (SNOMED CT, ICD-10). This is our strictest validation line.
aboutUs.EVAL_METHOD_2: Clinical Context Analysis: If there is no exact match, an expert AI evaluates whether the response is a valid clinical synonym (e.g., 'acute renal failure' vs. 'acute kidney injury'), recognizing successes that a simple text analysis would ignore.
aboutUs.EVAL_METHOD_3: Quality of Prioritization: This is our most innovative metric. It's not enough for the correct diagnosis to be on the list; we measure its average position. A correct diagnosis in the first position is infinitely more useful than in the fifth. This metric evaluates DxGPT's ability to prioritize like a specialist, offering maximum clinical relevance in the shortest possible time.
aboutUs.EVAL_SUBTITLE_5: What does this mean for the user?
aboutUs.EVAL_TEXT_8: This rigorous process translates into tangible benefits for your practice:
aboutUs.EVAL_BENEFIT_1: Confidence in every result: You know that the tool has been tested in complex and realistic scenarios.
aboutUs.EVAL_BENEFIT_2: Guaranteed consistency: The same clinical information produces the same structured analysis, every time.
aboutUs.EVAL_BENEFIT_3: Clinical relevance: The hypotheses are not only accurate, but are prioritized to reflect clinical urgency and probability.
aboutUs.EVAL_CONCLUSION: In short, DxGPT is not just an advanced model; it is a clinical support tool with a demonstrable commitment to evidence, reliability, and safety.
aboutUs.SECURITY_TITLE: Our pact of trust and security
aboutUs.SECURITY_INTRO: Trust is the foundation of medicine. At DxGPT, the protection of clinical data and regulatory compliance are not an afterthought, but the core of our design. We operate with radical transparency so that professionals and health systems can use our tool with complete peace of mind.
aboutUs.SECURITY_SUBTITLE_1: How we protect every query: A zero-retention process for personal information
aboutUs.SECURITY_TEXT_1: Our workflow is designed to maximize clinical utility and minimize the risk of data exposure to zero.
aboutUs.SECURITY_STEP_1: Data entry and automatic anonymization: Before any clinical information is processed by the AI model, our system automatically detects and removes any Personally Identifiable Information (PII). Names, addresses, or identification numbers are removed to ensure that only anonymous clinical data is processed.
aboutUs.SECURITY_STEP_2: In-memory processing: The diagnostic analysis is performed in real-time and in memory. We do not store any clinical or personal patient data on our servers.
aboutUs.SECURITY_STEP_3: Prohibition of retraining: The anonymous clinical data used for a query is never used to retrain or improve our AI models. This eliminates the risk of inadvertent learning from sensitive data and ensures the integrity of our system.
aboutUs.SECURITY_STEP_4: Zero footprint: Once the response is generated, the information that would allow the patient to be identified is completely deleted. No record of the personal clinical case remains on our platform.
aboutUs.SECURITY_TEXT_2: The following table summarizes our commitment to best practices in security and privacy, designed to facilitate evaluation by IT and regulatory compliance teams.
aboutUs.SECURITY_TABLE_ROW_1_2: Exclusively in European Union data centers (Microsoft Azure).
aboutUs.SECURITY_TABLE_ROW_2_2: Zero-retention policy. No Protected Health Information (PHI) is stored.
aboutUs.SECURITY_TABLE_ROW_3_2: Automatic and proactive. PII is identified and removed before processing.
aboutUs.SECURITY_TABLE_ROW_4_2: Strictly prohibited. User-submitted data is never used to train AI models.
aboutUs.SECURITY_TABLE_ROW_5_2: End-to-end. All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest.
aboutUs.SECURITY_TABLE_ROW_6_2: GDPR (EU), HIPAA (USA), EU AI Act (Alignment in progress).
aboutUs.SECURITY_TABLE_ROW_7_2: Business Associate Agreements (BAA) available for institutional partners.
aboutUs.SECURITY_TABLE_ROW_8_2: System activity is logged to monitor security and integrity (without storing PHI).
aboutUs.SECURITY_TEXT_3: We have extensive experience in the complex regulatory environment of digital health. DxGPT is designed to align with the most demanding standards worldwide:
aboutUs.SECURITY_REGULATION_1: GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation): We fully comply with the principles of lawfulness, transparency, data minimization, and purpose limitation. Exclusive processing in the EU ensures compliance with data sovereignty regulations.
aboutUs.SECURITY_REGULATION_2: HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act): Our architecture complies with the technical, physical, and administrative safeguards required by the HIPAA Security Rule, allowing us to sign BAAs with covered entities in the United States.
aboutUs.SECURITY_REGULATION_3: EU AI Act: We are actively working towards full alignment with the European Union's AI Act. We collaborate with experts and regulatory authorities to ensure that DxGPT meets the highest standards of risk management, data governance, transparency, and robustness, positioning us at the forefront of responsible AI in health.

quienesSomos.HERO_SUBTITLE: Revolutionizing the healthcare system with technology, breaking down barriers to leave no one behind.
quienesSomos.INTRO_TEXT: Foundation 29 is a non-profit organization. Our name is inspired by February 29th, the International Rare Disease Day. We research how the use of technology can help improve the lives of patients.
quienesSomos.VISION_TEXT: We dream of a world where diagnosing a rare disease doesn't take years, but days. Where artificial intelligence is an ally for doctors, researchers, and patients, helping to make faster, more accurate, and, above all, more humane decisions.
quienesSomos.CARD_1_TEXT: We use artificial intelligence to develop cutting-edge tools to solve real problems in the field of rare and common diseases.
quienesSomos.CARD_2_TEXT: We connect patients, families, doctors, and researchers from all over the world to create a network of support and shared knowledge.
quienesSomos.CARD_3_TEXT: Every line of code we write has a purpose: to improve real lives and give hope to those who need it most.
quienesSomos.CARD_4_TEXT: We facilitate medical research by providing platforms that accelerate the discovery and development of treatments.
quienesSomos.FOOTER_TEXT: Discover more about our projects and initiatives by visiting

transparencia.HERO_SUBTITLE: Committed to openness, collaboration, and responsibility in the development of medical technology.
transparencia.TECH_TEXT: We thank Microsoft, which through its AI for Good program provides us with the infrastructure on Azure and the support of employee volunteers. Also to Google, whose program for NGOs helps us increase the visibility of DxGPT in its search engine to reach more professionals and patients.
transparencia.TECH_MICROSOFT_DESC: Infrastructure on Azure and support from employee volunteers
transparencia.TECH_GOOGLE_DESC: Helps increase DxGPT's visibility to reach more professionals and patients
transparencia.SPONSORS_TEXT: We extend our deepest gratitude to our generous sponsors. Their support is purely philanthropic, with no commercial interests or data exchange, and is vital for developing tools like DxGPT and offering them for free.
transparencia.IMPL_TEXT: DxGPT is being implemented in real health services, improving the diagnosis of rare diseases and complex cases.
transparencia.IMPL_ARAGON_DESC: DxGPT is now available to healthcare professionals of the Aragonese Health Service, allowing for improved accuracy and speed in the diagnosis of rare and common diseases in the Aragon region.
transparencia.IMPL_SERMAS_DESC: Pioneering implementation of DxGPT in the health system of the Community of Madrid, providing access to more than 6,000 primary care physicians.
transparencia.IMPL_SERMAS_LINK_1: Microsoft News - SERMAS pioneer in generative AI
transparencia.IMPL_SERMAS_LINK_2: Community of Madrid - Access for 6,000 doctors
transparencia.IMPL_CATSALUT_DESC: Upcoming implementation in the Catalan health system, extending the benefits of DxGPT to a larger population of healthcare professionals.
transparencia.COLLAB_INTRO: Regardless of your professional background or the type of collaboration you are interested in, we are willing to listen and explore ways to work together.
transparencia.COLLAB_INTRO_2: us to start a conversation about how your experience and knowledge can contribute to democratizing access to AI-assisted medical diagnosis.
transparencia.COLLAB_HEALTH_P1: Health services and healthcare systems looking to integrate DxGPT into their clinical workflows can count on our specialized support. We offer complete technical implementation services, including integration with existing hospital systems, as well as customized configuration according to the specific needs of each institution.
transparencia.COLLAB_HEALTH_P2: Our implementation program also covers the training of medical teams, the establishment of clinical use protocols, and continuous technical support during the adoption process. For public health institutions, these implementations are carried out at no cost, as part of our commitment to democratizing access to advanced medical technologies.
transparencia.COLLAB_PROFESSIONALS_P1: The clinical experience of doctors and healthcare professionals is irreplaceable for the continuous development and improvement of DxGPT. We are looking for collaborators who can contribute their knowledge by reviewing complex cases, validating AI-assisted diagnoses, and providing guidance on the practical application of our tools in real clinical settings.
transparencia.COLLAB_PROFESSIONALS_P2: We especially value participation in clinical studies and controlled trials to validate diagnostic efficacy in different medical specialties. Likewise, feedback based on practical experience helps us identify areas for improvement and develop new functionalities that respond to real clinical needs.
transparencia.COLLAB_RESEARCH_P1: We invite medical centers, university hospitals, and research groups to collaborate on formal studies on the efficacy and impact of DxGPT in clinical diagnosis. These studies are fundamental to generate rigorous scientific evidence on the usefulness of artificial intelligence in medical practice and to validate our algorithms in different clinical contexts and patient populations.
transparencia.COLLAB_RESEARCH_P2: Our goal is to facilitate the generation of high-quality scientific evidence that contributes to global medical knowledge and demonstrates the clinical value of AI-assisted diagnostic tools.
transparencia.COLLAB_TECH_TEXT: Professionals in the technology field can contribute significantly to the advancement of DxGPT through specialized technical volunteering. Our needs range from the development of more intuitive and accessible user interfaces to technical consulting.
transparencia.COLLAB_PUBLICITY_P1: Visibility and recognition in the international medical community are crucial for the impact of DxGPT. We collaborate with specialized media, health sector organizations, and science communication professionals to disseminate success stories, research results, and technological advances.
transparencia.COLLAB_PUBLICITY_P2: We are interested in establishing strategic collaboration agreements with medical congresses, scientific societies, and healthcare organizations that share our vision of democratizing access to advanced diagnostic tools. These collaborations may include presentations at scientific events, joint publications, and continuing medical education programs.
transparencia.COLLAB_FINANCIAL_P1: The sustainability of DxGPT depends on the support of individuals and organizations committed to improving medical diagnosis. We offer multiple ways to contribute financially to this cause. Monetary donations allow us to maintain the technological infrastructure, develop new functionalities, and ensure that access to the platform remains completely free for all medical professionals. In addition, we greatly value contributions of anonymized medical data, which are essential for continuously training and improving our diagnostic algorithms.
transparencia.COLLAB_FINANCIAL_P2: If you wish to make a financial donation, you can do so directly through the links available on this page. For donations of medical data, our technical team will guide you on the anonymization protocols and formats compatible with our systems.
transparencia.COLLAB_CONCLUSION: DxGPT is a collaborative initiative that seeks to democratize access to AI-assisted medical diagnostic tools. Our goal is to make this technology accessible, free, and effective for healthcare professionals worldwide. Your participation, regardless of your professional background, is fundamental to achieving this purpose.

faqs.hero_subtitle: Resolve all your doubts about DxGPT and how it can help you in medical diagnosis.
faqs.q1: Is my medical information kept confidential?
faqs.a1: Yes, your privacy is our top priority. DxGPT is an initiative of Foundation 29, a non-profit organization committed to the rigorous protection of your personal and health data. We never sell, rent, or share your personal information with third parties for commercial or marketing purposes. All the data you provide is securely encrypted both during transmission and in storage. In addition, sensitive data is automatically anonymized before being saved, ensuring that no individual can be identified. Access to your data is strictly controlled and limited to authorized personnel who comply with strict confidentiality obligations, in full compliance with GDPR and HIPAA regulations.
faqs.q2: Can I use DxGPT in emergency situations?
faqs.a2: No, DxGPT is not designed or intended to manage medical emergencies or urgent conditions. In case of an emergency, contact local emergency services immediately or go to the nearest medical center. DxGPT has been developed as a support resource for healthcare professionals, with the aim of improving diagnostic processes and decision-making. However, it should never be considered a substitute for professional judgment or immediate intervention by qualified medical personnel.
faqs.q3: How does DxGPT suggest possible diagnoses?
faqs.a3: DxGPT uses advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning models to analyze the symptoms and clinical information provided by healthcare professionals. It compares this data with an extensive medical knowledge base to suggest possible conditions. DxGPT is not a medical device; it functions as a clinical decision support system. This means it helps professionals by providing guidance on possible diagnoses, but it does not replace their clinical judgment or professional evaluation. DxGPT's suggestions are intended to help identify potential diagnoses and guide further investigations, but a qualified healthcare professional should always be consulted for a definitive diagnosis and treatment.
faqs.q4: Can I talk to a human doctor through DxGPT?
faqs.a4: Currently, DxGPT is fully automated and does not allow direct communication with doctors or other healthcare personnel. For any specific health concerns or detailed medical inquiries, please contact your usual healthcare professional or seek medical advice directly.
faqs.a5: Yes, DxGPT is available to users worldwide. However, it is important to note that medical practices, terminology, and healthcare standards can vary significantly between countries and regions. DxGPT tries to provide universally applicable information, but users should interpret its suggestions within the context of local medical practices and standards.
faqs.q6: In which languages can I use DxGPT?
faqs.a6: DxGPT can process inputs and generate responses in virtually any language. However, as its training was based primarily on English data, responses in this language tend to have greater accuracy and reliability. For languages with less available medical data or fewer users, suggestions may occasionally be less accurate or incomplete. We encourage you to use DxGPT in your preferred or native language and share your experience with us. This helps us to continuously improve its capability and accuracy in different languages.
faqs.q7: How often is DxGPT's medical information updated?
faqs.a7: DxGPT does not directly update its internal database or knowledge. Instead, our team conducts constant testing and evaluation of the most advanced artificial intelligence models and algorithms. We carry out clinical studies in collaboration with hospitals and medical institutions to verify and improve DxGPT's performance, with special attention to its accuracy in diagnosing rare diseases and complex cases. This continuous process ensures that DxGPT remains up-to-date and effective.
faqs.q8: How can I send feedback about DxGPT?
faqs.a8: Your feedback is very important for the continuous improvement of DxGPT. You can easily send feedback from the application using the red tab located on the right side of the interface. You can also write to us by email at support@foundation29.org. We carefully review all comments and suggestions to improve our service.
faqs.q9: Can I see statistics on the use of DxGPT?
faqs.a9: Yes, you can access complete statistics in the 'Usage statistics' section, located in the top menu of the DxGPT interface. There you will find detailed information such as the total number of users, the most entered symptoms, the most suggested diagnoses, the geographical distribution of users, and a summary of the feedback. These statistics are presented anonymously and do not contain information that allows any user to be identified.
faqs.q10: Who can collaborate on the development of DxGPT?
faqs.a10: We actively seek and welcome collaborations with researchers, healthcare professionals, medical institutions, and organizations interested in advancing AI-assisted diagnostic technologies. If you wish to contribute to the project or explore joint research opportunities, please write to us at support@foundation29.org or complete the contact form available on our official website. Collaboration allows us to continuously improve the capabilities and practical utility of DxGPT.
faqs.q11: I represent a patient group. How can we collaborate with DxGPT?
faqs.a11: If you represent a patient group or support organization, we encourage you to collaborate by promoting DxGPT within your community. We are particularly interested in learning about your group's experiences with specific medical conditions, as this information helps us to better understand your needs and adapt DxGPT accordingly. Please contact us to discuss possible ways of collaboration and how DxGPT can support your group.
faqs.q12: Is DxGPT considered a medical device?
faqs.a12: No. DxGPT is not classified or regulated as a medical device under international regulations such as the European Union's Medical Device Regulation (EU MDR) or the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). DxGPT is used exclusively as an experimental clinical decision support tool, designed to assist qualified healthcare professionals with guidance and diagnostic suggestions. It should always be used as a supplement to, and not a substitute for, professional medical evaluation.
faqs.a13: Yes, DxGPT is completely free. It is developed and maintained as a non-profit project by Foundation 29, funded through philanthropic donations, grants, and collaborations. Our goal is to offer advanced AI-assisted diagnostic tools at no cost to healthcare professionals and patients worldwide, promoting equity and access in medical diagnosis.
faqs.q14: Is my information used for other purposes?
faqs.a14: DxGPT never uses your personal data for other purposes such as marketing or commercial activities. We strictly use aggregated and anonymous data, such as general usage patterns, frequent symptoms and diagnostic suggestions, and general trends, to improve the accuracy, reliability, and functionality of our algorithms. This aggregated data is completely anonymized and ensures that no individual user can be identified from this information.
